artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Maruya Jinpachi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 21; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 305.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: standing man at right wearing short black kimono with white underskirt, holding a brown cord attached around the neck of a seated figure in green at left; landscape in background with blue-grey sculpture base at right
markings: Artist’s seal: ヨし{Yoshi} | Censor seal: 申四改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Syllabary Copybook of the Treasury of Loyal Retainers (Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
text: Actors Nakamura Fukusuke I as Ono Sadakurō (R) and Ōtani Tokuji II as Yoichibei (R). Related to the play Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵, performed at the Nakamura Theater in the 4th month of 1860.
title: Fifth Act
